title: Mexico Beach Hopping: 12 Days
subtitle: Caribbean, Pacific & Sea of Cortez
meta_title: Mexico Beach Itinerary 12 Days - Best Beaches Caribbean to Pacific 2025
meta_description: 12-day Mexico beach hopping itinerary: Tulum's Caribbean turquoise, Puerto Escondido's surf, Sayulita's charm, and Los Cabos luxury. Ultimate beach lover's guide.
hero_alt: Turquoise Caribbean waters on Mexican beach
introduction: Mexico's coastlines offer incredible diversity—from the turquoise Caribbean and its cenotes to the powerful Pacific surf breaks and the dramatic Sea of Cortez. This 12-day itinerary takes you to four distinct beach destinations, each with its own personality, from bohemian backpacker to luxury resort.
best_time: November-April (dry season, best weather coast to coast)
budget: $2,000-4,000 per person (varies greatly by accommodation choices)
highlights: Swim in Caribbean turquoise waters and cenotes near Tulum
Catch world-class waves at Puerto Escondido's Zicatela
Experience laid-back surf culture in Sayulita
Spot whales and swim with sea lions in Los Cabos
Four distinct beach vibes: bohemian, surf, village, luxury
Mix of adventure, relaxation, and nightlife

days.title: Arrive Tulum - Caribbean Coast
days.description: Begin on the Caribbean with Tulum's famous turquoise waters and jungle backdrop.

activities.title: Arrive Cancún & Transfer
activities.description: Fly into Cancún International Airport (CUN). Transfer to Tulum (2 hours) by private shuttle, ADO bus, or rental car.
activities.tips: Pre-book transfer for easiest arrival. ADO bus is comfortable and cheap ($15-20 USD). Tulum Pueblo is cheaper than the beach hotel zone.

activities.title: Beach Sunset
activities.description: Head to the beach to catch your first Caribbean sunset. The beach clubs along Tulum's strip welcome day visitors (with minimum spend).
activities.tips: Papaya Playa Project, Coco Tulum, or Ahau have great sunset vibes. Beach zone is pricey—budget accordingly.

activities.title: Dinner in Tulum Pueblo
activities.description: Eat in town for better value. Tulum Pueblo has excellent restaurants at half the beach zone prices.
activities.tips: Taquería Honorio for tacos, Hartwood (reservations needed), or Posada Margherita for Italian. The pueblo has its own charm.

days.title: Tulum Ruins & Cenotes
days.description: Explore clifftop Mayan ruins and swim in crystal-clear cenotes.

activities.title: Tulum Ruins at Opening
activities.description: Arrive when the archaeological site opens to beat crowds and heat. These are the only major Mayan ruins overlooking the Caribbean—the views are stunning.
activities.tips: Bring swimsuit—there's a beach below the ruins. Hire a guide for context or explore independently. $85 MXN entry.

activities.title: Cenote Gran Cenote
activities.description: Cool off at Gran Cenote, one of the most beautiful and accessible cenotes. Snorkel through caverns with stalactites and spot turtles.
activities.tips: Rent snorkel gear there. Reef-safe sunscreen only (or none—the water is cool). Go early or late to avoid peak crowds.

activities.title: Lunch & Beach Time
activities.description: Lunch in town, then spend the afternoon on Tulum's beaches. The southern beaches near the Sian Ka'an biosphere are less crowded.
activities.tips: Las Palmas beach is public access. Bring your own drinks and snacks to avoid beach club minimums.

activities.title: Dinner & Nightlife
activities.description: Tulum has a vibrant evening scene. Start with dinner, then check out beach club events or cenote parties.
activities.tips: Check event listings—Papaya Playa, Rosa Negra, and others host DJs and events. Full moon parties are popular.

days.title: Tulum - Lagoon & Free Day
days.description: Explore the seven-colored lagoon of Bacalar or enjoy a free beach day.

activities.time: Option A: Day Trip to Bacalar
activities.title: Laguna Bacalar
activities.description: Drive 2 hours south to the stunning 'Lagoon of Seven Colors.' Swim, kayak, or paddleboard in crystal-clear fresh water with varying shades of blue.
activities.tips: Rent a car or join a tour. Cenote Azul is a great stop en route. The lagoon is peaceful compared to Tulum.

activities.title: Beach & Cenote Exploration
activities.description: Sleep in, yoga on the beach, visit more cenotes (Cenote Dos Ojos is incredible for snorkeling), or just relax.
activities.tips: Tulum has endless cenotes to explore. Dos Ojos and Casa Cenote are favorites. Book a diving excursion if certified.

activities.title: Last Tulum Night
activities.description: Final dinner and evening in Tulum before moving to the Pacific tomorrow.
activities.tips: Try somewhere new or revisit a favorite. Pack for an early flight.

days.title: Fly to Puerto Escondido - Pacific Surf
days.description: Cross Mexico to the powerful Pacific waves of Oaxaca's coast.

activities.title: Transfer & Fly to Puerto Escondido
activities.description: Early transfer to Cancún airport. Fly to Puerto Escondido (PXM) via Mexico City connection. Total travel time approximately 6-7 hours.
activities.tips: Book flights well ahead. Volaris and Viva fly this route. The travel day is worth it for the beach diversity.

activities.title: Arrive & Settle In
activities.description: Check into your hotel in La Punta or Zicatela. These two beach areas have very different vibes—La Punta is mellow and beginner-friendly, Zicatela is intense surf territory.
activities.tips: La Punta for relaxed surf vibe and swimmable beach. Zicatela for serious surfers and spectating massive waves.

activities.title: Sunset at Punta Zicatela
activities.description: Walk to the point where surfers catch the last waves of the day. Watch the sun sink into the Pacific with a cold beer.
activities.tips: This is the daily ritual. The rocks at the point are perfect for sunset watching.

activities.title: Fresh Seafood Dinner
activities.description: Puerto Escondido has incredible seafood straight from local fishermen. Try ceviche, tuna tostadas, or whole grilled fish.
activities.tips: Espadin, El Cafecito, or simple beach palapas all serve excellent seafood at reasonable prices.

days.accommodation: Hotel in Puerto Escondido (La Punta or Zicatela)

days.title: Puerto Escondido - Surf & Sun
days.description: Learn to surf, watch the pros, and soak up Oaxacan beach culture.

activities.title: Sunrise Surf Lesson
activities.description: Take a beginner surf lesson at La Punta where waves are gentler. Early morning has the best conditions and fewer crowds.
activities.tips: Oasis Surf and Central Surf are reputable schools. Even one lesson will get you standing on a board.

activities.title: Breakfast & Beach
activities.description: Post-surf breakfast at a beach café. Spend the morning swimming at Playa Carrizalillo—a sheltered cove perfect for swimming.
activities.tips: Carrizalillo has stairs down (170+ steps) but it's worth it. Calm, beautiful, and great snorkeling.

activities.title: Watch Zicatela
activities.description: Head to Zicatela beach to watch expert surfers tackle the 'Mexican Pipeline.' These are serious, powerful waves—incredible to witness.
activities.tips: Don't swim at Zicatela unless you're an expert—the current is deadly. Watching from the beach is the way to experience it.

activities.title: Mezcal & Sunset
activities.description: Oaxacan coast means excellent mezcal. Find a beach bar with sunset views for smoky cocktails.
activities.tips: Mezcal is the local drink. Try it straight or in a cocktail. The sunset over the Pacific never gets old.

activities.title: Dinner & Nightlife
activities.description: Puerto has a lively nightlife scene, especially on weekends. Dinner followed by beach bars and dancing.
activities.tips: La Punta has mellow beach bars. Zicatela has more party energy. Things get going late.

days.title: Puerto Escondido - Bioluminescence
days.description: Daytime adventure and magical nighttime bioluminescent kayaking.

activities.title: Morning Yoga or Surf
activities.description: Start with beach yoga or another surf session. The surf culture here means plenty of wellness options.
activities.tips: Many hotels and beach spots offer morning yoga. Or rent a board and practice what you learned.

activities.title: Beach Day & Lunch
activities.description: Relax on the beach, read, swim, nap. Puerto rewards those who slow down. Long beachside lunch with ceviche and cold drinks.
activities.tips: This is the rhythm of beach life here. Don't rush—you're on Mexican time.

activities.title: Early Dinner
activities.description: Eat early before tonight's adventure. Something light that won't weigh you down for kayaking.
activities.tips: Stay close to your hotel—you'll be picked up for the lagoon tour.

activities.title: Laguna de Manialtepec
activities.description: Drive to the mangrove lagoon for bioluminescent kayaking. As darkness falls, the water glows blue-green with every paddle stroke and swimming motion.
activities.tips: Best on dark nights (new moon). July-January has strongest bioluminescence. Swimming in glowing water is unforgettable.

days.title: Fly to Puerto Vallarta - Sayulita
days.description: Travel to the charming surf village of Sayulita on the Riviera Nayarit.

activities.title: Fly to Puerto Vallarta
activities.description: Morning flight from Puerto Escondido to Puerto Vallarta (PVR). Usually requires connection through CDMX or Guadalajara.
activities.tips: Volaris often has cheaper fares. PVR is a large airport with good connections.

activities.title: Transfer to Sayulita
activities.description: Drive 45 minutes north to Sayulita, a colorful surf village that's grown into a popular destination while retaining its charm.
activities.tips: Uber works from PVR airport. Or arrange a private transfer. The drive along the coast is scenic.

activities.title: Explore Sayulita Village
activities.description: Walk the cobblestone streets lined with boutiques, restaurants, and surf shops. The main beach is right in town—swim, watch surfers, or rent a board.
activities.tips: Sayulita is compact and walkable. The cemetery overlook has great sunset views.

activities.title: Dinner on the Plaza
activities.description: Dine at one of the restaurants surrounding the main plaza. The village atmosphere is festive and welcoming.
activities.tips: Don Pedro's is a Sayulita institution. Mary's for breakfast/brunch. Countless taquerias for cheap eats.

days.title: Sayulita - Surf & Village Life
days.description: Experience the laid-back surf culture and explore nearby beaches.

activities.title: Surf Lesson or Morning Session
activities.description: Sayulita's waves are perfect for beginners and intermediates. Gentle, consistent, and right in front of town.
activities.tips: Lunazul Surf School and Wildmex are reputable. The main beach can get crowded—arrive early.

activities.title: Brunch & Shopping
activities.description: Browse Sayulita's excellent boutiques selling Huichol art, textiles, surf gear, and jewelry. Brunch at a beachfront café.
activities.tips: The Huichol (Wixárika) beadwork art is stunning and authentic. Prices are fair for the craftsmanship.

activities.title: Playa de los Muertos
activities.description: Walk or boat to this nearby hidden beach accessible over the hill or by water taxi. Calmer, less crowded, great snorkeling.
activities.tips: The hike over takes 10 minutes. Water taxis run from the main beach. Bring snorkel gear.

activities.title: Sunset Rooftop Drinks
activities.description: Sayulita has several rooftop bars perfect for sunset. The views over the bay are spectacular.
activities.tips: Si Señor and Tierra Viva have rooftop seating. Arrive early for best spots.

activities.title: Dinner & Live Music
activities.description: Many restaurants feature live music. The village has a vibrant, family-friendly evening scene.
activities.tips: Check what's playing at Don Pedro's or Bar Sayulita. The vibe is casual and fun.

days.title: Sayulita - San Pancho & Punta Mita
days.description: Explore the quieter neighboring beach towns.

activities.title: San Pancho (San Francisco)
activities.description: Drive or taxi 10 minutes to San Pancho, Sayulita's mellower neighbor. This artistic town has a long beach, excellent restaurants, and a quieter vibe.
activities.tips: Walk the main street for boutiques and cafés. The beach is less crowded and great for swimming. La Ola Rica has great coffee.

activities.title: Lunch in San Pancho
activities.description: San Pancho punches above its weight for food. Several excellent restaurants serve creative cuisine.
activities.tips: María's for Mexican, Café del Mar for seafood views. The town supports local and sustainable businesses.

activities.title: Punta Mita Peninsula
activities.description: Continue to Punta Mita, the exclusive peninsula with luxury resorts, excellent beaches, and the famous Marietas Islands offshore.
activities.tips: The public beaches (Playa Anclote) are accessible and beautiful. Boat tours to Marietas Islands depart from here.

activities.title: Return to Sayulita
activities.description: Head back for a final evening in Sayulita. Dinner and drinks in this charming village.
activities.tips: Tomorrow you head to Los Cabos—enjoy Sayulita's village atmosphere one more night.

days.title: Fly to Los Cabos - Sea of Cortez
days.description: Travel to the dramatic desert-meets-ocean landscape of Baja California Sur.

activities.title: Fly to Los Cabos
activities.description: Transfer to Puerto Vallarta airport and fly to Los Cabos (SJD). Short 2-hour flight across the Sea of Cortez.
activities.tips: Window seat for dramatic views of Baja's desert landscapes and coastline.

activities.title: Arrive & Check In
activities.description: Arrive in San José del Cabo or Cabo San Lucas (different vibes—San José is artistic and quiet, Cabo is party and resorts). Check into your hotel.
activities.tips: The Corridor between the two towns has major resorts. San José for culture, Cabo for nightlife.

activities.title: El Arco Boat Tour
activities.description: Take a water taxi or glass-bottom boat to El Arco, the iconic rock arch where the Pacific meets the Sea of Cortez. Sea lions lounge on the rocks.
activities.tips: Tours leave from Cabo San Lucas marina. Late afternoon light is beautiful. You'll see Lover's Beach and Divorce Beach.

activities.title: Marina Dinner
activities.description: Dine at the Cabo San Lucas marina with views of yachts and the harbor. The marina area has dozens of restaurants.
activities.tips: Lorenzillo's for lobster, Edith's for romantic atmosphere. Marina is touristy but fun for first night.

days.title: Los Cabos - Sea Adventures
days.description: Experience world-class marine life in the Sea of Cortez.

activities.title: Whale Watching (Seasonal)
activities.description: December-April, humpback and gray whales migrate through. Take a morning whale watching tour—the sightings are spectacular.
activities.tips: Book with a responsible operator. Morning tours have calmer seas. Bring binoculars and camera.

activities.title: Alternative: Snorkel at Cabo Pulmo
activities.description: If not whale season, drive 2 hours to Cabo Pulmo, a protected marine park with the only coral reef in the Sea of Cortez. Incredible snorkeling.
activities.tips: Rent a car or join a tour. The reef has recovered dramatically since fishing was banned—shark sightings common.

activities.title: Beach Club Lunch
activities.description: Enjoy lunch at a beach club along the Corridor. Many resorts allow day passes with food/drink minimum.
activities.tips: Chileno Beach and Santa Maria Beach are public with good swimming. Some Corridor beaches have strong currents.

activities.title: San José del Cabo Art Walk (Thursday)
activities.description: If it's Thursday, don't miss the Art Walk. Galleries open late, wine flows, live music fills the streets.
activities.tips: Thursday 5-9pm November-June. The historic center transforms into a party. Plan your trip to include a Thursday if possible.

activities.title: Fine Dining
activities.description: Los Cabos has excellent upscale restaurants. Treat yourself to a memorable dinner.
activities.tips: Flora Farms (farm-to-table), Nick-San (sushi), Don Sanchez (Mexican). Reservations essential.

activities.title: Sunrise Beach Walk
activities.description: Take a final walk on the beach. The Sea of Cortez light in the morning is golden and peaceful.
activities.tips: Medano Beach in Cabo San Lucas or the beaches near your hotel. Reflect on 12 incredible beach days.

activities.title: Brunch
activities.description: Leisurely brunch before heading to the airport.
activities.tips: The Office on the Beach is a Cabo institution—literally on the sand.

activities.title: Transfer to Airport
activities.description: Head to Los Cabos International Airport (SJD) for your departure flight.
activities.tips: SJD is an efficient airport. Allow standard international time (2-3 hours before).

practical_info.getting_there: Fly into Cancún (CUN), internal flights to Puerto Escondido (PXM), Puerto Vallarta (PVR), Los Cabos (SJD). Domestic flights on Volaris, Viva, Aeromexico.
practical_info.getting_around: Uber in tourist areas. Taxis where Uber isn't available. Rental cars optional but helpful in Puerto Escondido and Los Cabos.
practical_info.where_to_stay: Ranges from hostels ($15-30) to luxury resorts ($500+). Each destination has options across all budgets.
practical_info.money: Budget varies wildly by accommodation. $100-200/day comfortable mid-range. Los Cabos is most expensive, Puerto Escondido cheapest.
practical_info.best_beaches_summary: Tulum: Caribbean turquoise, cenotes. Puerto Escondido: Powerful surf, raw beauty. Sayulita: Surf village charm. Los Cabos: Dramatic desert-ocean, marine life.

packing_tips: Light layers for evening (Sayulita can be cool)
Sandals and one nice outfit for dinners
